ingredients.item: 180g pack raw jumbo king prawns, roughly chopped
3 tbsp Cooksâ€™ Ingredients Balti Curry Paste

instructions.step: Place the flour and salt in a large bowl, and add the oil. Gradually mix in approximately 300ml warm water to form a soft dough. Transfer to an oiled bowl, cover and leave for 30 minutes.
Meanwhile, mix together the prawns, baby corn, salad onions, balti paste and 1 tbsp coriander. Heat 1 tbsp ghee in a frying pan and fry the prawn mixture for 4-5 minutes until cooked through.

On a floured surface, divide the dough into 4 pieces and roll each out into a thin round, about 22cm in diameter. Heat a little of the remaining ghee in a frying pan and add 1 paratha. Spoon a quarter of the prawn mixture onto half the paratha, spreading it around. Fold the plain side over and cook for 1-2 minutes until golden. Flip the paratha and cook for a further 1-2 minutes. Repeat with the other 3 parathas.
Cut each paratha into 3 triangles and scatter with the remaining coriander.
